abstract: Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase are hoarding cash as if another crisis were on the way, with Citi almost doubling its cash to $244.2 billion in the year since Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy.
snippet: Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase are hoarding cash as if another crisis were on the way, with Citi almost doubling its cash to $244.2 billion in the year since Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase are hoarding cash as if another crisis were on the way, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Citigroup and JPMorgan Said to Stockpile Cash
